question_text: Why is signal degradation a greater concern with VGA compared to DVI-D at the same cable length?
answer_options: VGA uses thinner conductors than DVI-D cables
VGA transmits uncompressed audio with video
VGA uses analog signals which are more susceptible to interference
DVI-D uses encryption that reduces signal noise
correct_answer: VGA uses analog signals which are more susceptible to interference
explanation: Analog video signals from VGA degrade faster and are more prone to distortion over longer distances than digital signals from DVI-D.
